body.value:
Drylands, particularly in Africa, are once more taking centre stage in numerous policy debates. The United Nations has declared 2006 the International Year of Deserts and Desertification, focusing attention on the importance of drylands to the international environmental agenda. But who drives this agenda and for what purpose? 

The bulletin has a new look, it has been restructured so that there are now six sections in addition to the EDITORIAL. A short NEWS section highlighting key events, three central sections, PEOPLE, POLICIES and PROGRAMMES, which constitute the heart of the bulletin where a broad range of subjects of direct relevance to drylands areas are covered in more depth. The RESOURCES section, where you'll find book reviews and information on a range of other materials or events and the BACK PAGE, introducing each of the accompanying Issue Papers.
body.processed:
Drylands, particularly in Africa, are once more taking centre stage in numerous policy debates. The United Nations has declared 2006 the International Year of Deserts and Desertification, focusing attention on the importance of drylands to the international environmental agenda. But who drives this agenda and for what purpose?

The bulletin has a new look, it has been restructured so that there are now six sections in addition to the EDITORIAL. A short NEWS section highlighting key events, three central sections, PEOPLE, POLICIES and PROGRAMMES, which constitute the heart of the bulletin where a broad range of subjects of direct relevance to drylands areas are covered in more depth. The RESOURCES section, where you'll find book reviews and information on a range of other materials or events and the BACK PAGE, introducing each of the accompanying Issue Papers.

body.value: The Drylands Programme's bulletin Haramata has become established as a major networking and information channel for those working for the sustainable development of drylands areas, mainly in Africa, but also in Asia. Three to four Issue Papers of about 30 pages accompany each Haramata, allowing for subjects to be treated in greater depth. Every edition of Haramata and the Issue Papers is published in both French and English.

body.value: This new look. full colour, 50th issue of Haramata, bulletin of the drylands looks at changes in the region over the last 20 years and the present and future challenges facing people in the drylands regions.
body.processed: This new look. full colour, 50th issue of Haramata, bulletin of the drylands looks at changes in the region over the last 20 years and the present and future challenges facing people in the drylands regions.

body.value: In Haramata 51, featured articles include governance in Namibia's communal area conservancies and food sovereignty in Mali and responses to articles in Haramata 50. In the Innovations section we look at biotechnology in Morocco and the use of photography among the Karimojong. It also includes resources and readers' feedback. The majority of articles are written by contributors from dryland regions.
body.processed: In Haramata 51, featured articles include governance in Namibia's communal area conservancies and food sovereignty in Mali and responses to articles in Haramata 50. In the Innovations section we look at biotechnology in Morocco and the use of photography among the Karimojong. It also includes resources and readers' feedback. The majority of articles are written by contributors from dryland regions.

body.value: This issue has a special focus on climate change in the drylands. It also includes the regular sections - NEWS, DEBATE, REPORTS, INNOVATIONS, BOOKS & RESOURCES.
body.processed: This issue has a special focus on climate change in the drylands. It also includes the regular sections - NEWS, DEBATE, REPORTS, INNOVATIONS, BOOKS & RESOURCES.

body.value: In this issue: ~DEBATE: Anchoring gender in African realities * A spectacular case of regeneration in Niger~FOCUS ON...China in Africa ~REPORTS: So why don't they plan for droughts in pastoral areas? * Making land reform work for those who need it least - a lesson from South Africa~This issue has a special theme section on China in Africa and includes an article on Chinatown in Dakar, Senegal and one on the export of timber to China from Mozambique. ~Also includes the regular sections: NEWS * INNOVATIONS * BOOKS AND RESOURCES * TAKEAWAY~Haramata is published twice a year - subscriptions are free and include 2-3 Issue Papers. FOr more info contact drylands@iied.org
body.processed: In this issue: ~DEBATE: Anchoring gender in African realities * A spectacular case of regeneration in Niger~FOCUS ON...China in Africa ~REPORTS: So why don't they plan for droughts in pastoral areas? * Making land reform work for those who need it least - a lesson from South Africa~This issue has a special theme section on China in Africa and includes an article on Chinatown in Dakar, Senegal and one on the export of timber to China from Mozambique. ~Also includes the regular sections: NEWS * INNOVATIONS * BOOKS AND RESOURCES * TAKEAWAY~Haramata is published twice a year - subscriptions are free and include 2-3 Issue Papers. FOr more info contact drylands@iied.org

body.value: In this issue - ~DEBATE: Fertilisers and the food crisis: debating soil fertility in Africa - Gender based violence among the Afar in Ethiopia. FOCUS ON..BIOFUELS: A polarised debate? - What do the experts say? - Bioenergy and pastoralism - Biofuels and land rights in Mozambique - A view from India. REPORTS: Dakar's building boom - WoDaaBe herders turn unpredictability into a key resource. INNOVATIONS: Using mobile phones in pastoral livestock marketing in Kenya. FEEDBACK: Offsetting the problem?. BOOKS AND RESOURCES.~Published twice a year. To subscribe email: drylands@iied.org

body.value:
In this, the last issue of Haramata, we focus on adaptation to climate change with articles on a range of projects and initiatives from across East and West Africa to support local communities to understand climate change and plan for it. The issue also looks at the Family Code in Mali, Nomadic Education in Kenya, and includes the regular sections on News, Innovations and Resources from the African drylands.

This issue was produced in collaboration with Arid Land Information Network (ALIN-EA) in Kenya and IED-Afrique in Senegal.
body.processed:
In this, the last issue of Haramata, we focus on adaptation to climate change with articles on a range of projects and initiatives from across East and West Africa to support local communities to understand climate change and plan for it. The issue also looks at the Family Code in Mali, Nomadic Education in Kenya, and includes the regular sections on News, Innovations and Resources from the African drylands.

This issue was produced in collaboration with Arid Land Information Network (ALIN-EA) in Kenya and IED-Afrique in Senegal.
